title: Q16 Spelling MC
prompt: Which two sentences contain a misspelled word?
feedback:
One sentence with a misspelled word is “When a senator filibusters, he or she usually wants to stop a bill from passing and becomming law.” The word “becomming” is misspelled. The correct spelling is “becoming.” When a word such as “become” takes an ending such as -ing, the silent “e” is removed, but the end consonant is not doubled.

The sentence "The first known filibusters were in the senate of anceint Rome." also has a misspelled word. The word "ancient" follows the rule "i before e except after c." The correct spelling is "ancient."
